title: Add PLAYBOOK.md (Codex CLI Thread Playbook condensed for this repo)
context: This repo is a long-term Codex CLI playground. We want a single, concise document that explains how we run tasks here (TaskSpec → codex exec → tests/validation → commit) and how to scale to threads/worktrees later.
instructions: Create a new file PLAYBOOK.md at the repo root.
PLAYBOOK.md must be written in Chinese (you may include short English command snippets).
Content requirements (keep it practical, not essay):
- Purpose & scope: this repo is a long-term playground.
- Roles: what Zero can do vs what the human must do (clearly labeled).
- Standard workflow (the minimal loop): write TaskSpec → run codex exec → run tests → validate TaskResult → commit/push.
- Provide PowerShell command templates for: creating venv + installing requirements; running pytest; validating a TaskResult JSON.
- Provide a codex exec prompt template that references a TaskSpec file and requires ONLY TaskResult JSON output.
- Brief section on scaling: /new /fork /resume and when to use git worktree.
- Keep it <= ~150 lines; prefer bullet lists.
If needed to satisfy Codex --output-schema constraints, you may update docs/contracts/task_result_v0_1.schema.json required fields (no other behavioral changes).
Do NOT change any other files.
acceptance: A new file PLAYBOOK.md exists at repo root.
PLAYBOOK.md is Chinese, concise, and includes the required command/prompt templates.
